Description: Cast square flat weight in copper alloy; engraved signs on one side; second sign partially hiden below corrosion; surfaces corroded.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Oriental Institute, University of Chicago. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to the drawing published by Petrie, the signs engraved on one side of the weight are two rectangles (Petrie 1886, pl. XXII, no. 99). Petrie explained that the signs could be understood as a standard mark, corresponding to half of a Roman uncia (Petrie 1886, 82, no. 494).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 79 and 82 no. 494, pl. XXII, no. 99)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (VB.188) (phase 3)
